title: Georgia House - Day 38 (2026-03-31)
summary:
Overview: This Georgia House session included discussions on bills related to education and wildlife, as well as a tribute to the passing of an iconic Georgia Southern Eagle mascot.

Key Actions:
- **HB 851**: Legislation regarding education policy
- **HB 852**: Bill on wildlife and environmental issues
- **SB 121**: Passage of state budget
- **SB 8**: Bill addressing child safety

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
- No new bills were introduced.

Notable Moments:
- The House paid tribute to "Freedom", the Georgia Southern Eagle mascot, who recently passed away. Members recognized the iconic status of the eagle and the work of the handler, Steve Hines.
- The House chaplain, Dr. Rich Conwacher, delivered an inspirational sermon drawing from the Sermon on the Mount.

Votes:
- **HB 851**: Passed
- **HB 852**: Passed
- **SB 121**: Passed unanimously 
- **SB 8**: Passed with some opposition

Attendance:
- All members were present for the session.

Adjournment:
- The House adjourned after completing its agenda. The next session is scheduled for April 1, 2026.
